abstract: Increase in rocket fire from Pakistani border with Afghanistan is fueling frustration among Afghan and American soldiers and officials who suspect, but cannot prove, a Pakistani government role; Pakistani officials repeatedly deny aiding fighters for Taliban and Haqqani militant network, who operate on both sides of the border, and insist that they try to prevent incursions or violence.
snippet: An increase in rocket fire into Afghanistan from Pakistani territory has fed suspicion and resentment among American troops.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

lead_paragraph: An increase in rocket fire into Afghanistan from Pakistani territory has fed suspicion and resentment among American troops.

headline.main: Tensions Flare as G.I.’s Take Fire Out of Pakistan
headline.print_headline: Tensions Flare as G.I.’s Take Fire Out of Pakistan
headline.seo: Cross-Border Fire Frustrates Troops in Afghanistan
